docs.lead_paragraph: Yahoo CEO Marissa Mayer is promising to be away from the job for just a "limited time" when she gives birth to twins later this year, but the development only adds to the uncertainty some investors have long had about Yahoo.

headline.main: CEOs Big News Can Cause Ripple Effects for Company
headline.print_headline: CEOs Big News Can Cause Ripple Effects for Company

docs.snippet: Yahoo CEO Marissa Mayer is promising to be away from the job for just a "limited time" when she gives birth to twins later this year, but the development only adds to the uncertainty some investors have long had about Yahoo.

docs.lead_paragraph: Pope Francis is applying his vision of a merciful church to women who have had abortions, easing their path toward forgiveness and saying he realizes some felt they had no choice but to make "this agonizing and painful decision."

headline.main: Pope: Priests in Holy Year Can Absolve 'Sin of Abortion'

docs.lead_paragraph: Yahoo CEO Marissa Mayer is going to give birth to twins while trying to deliver a long-promised turnaround at the struggling Internet company.

headline.main: Yahoo CEO to Give Birth to Twins While Tackling Turnaround
headline.print_headline: Yahoo CEO to Give Birth to Twins While Tackling Turnaround

docs.snippet: Yahoo CEO Marissa Mayer is going to give birth to twins while trying to deliver a long-promised turnaround at the struggling Internet company.

headline.main: Marissa Mayer of Yahoo Says She’s Pregnant With Twins

docs.abstract: Ms. Mayer said Monday that her twins were due in December and that she planned to work throughout her pregnancy.
docs.snippet: Ms. Mayer said Monday that her twins were due in December and that she planned to work throughout her pregnancy.

docs.abstract: Vivane Dalles labored to find the money — and outside interest — to pursue an intensive project on teenage mothers in France.
docs.snippet: Vivane Dalles labored to find the money — and outside interest — to pursue an intensive project on teenage mothers in France.

docs.lead_paragraph: Yahoo Inc Chief Executive Marissa Mayer said she was pregnant with identical twin girls, likely due in December, but promised she would take limited time away as she works toward turning around the company's struggling online ad business.

headline.main: Yahoo CEO Marissa Mayer Expecting Twin Girls in December
headline.print_headline: Yahoo CEO Marissa Mayer Expecting Twin Girls in December

docs.snippet: Yahoo Inc Chief Executive Marissa Mayer said she was pregnant with identical twin girls, likely due in December, but promised she would take limited time away as she works toward turning around the company's struggling online ad business.

docs.lead_paragraph: La mortalidad materna es elevada en Chiapas y en muchas regiones pobres del mundo.

headline.main: Parteras tradicionales aprenden nuevas técnicas para ayudar a las futuras madres de Chiapas

docs.snippet: La mortalidad materna es elevada en Chiapas y en muchas regiones pobres del mundo.

byline.contributor: Janet Jarman colaboró con este reportaje desde México.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Mexican state, like many poor areas, has a high death rate among mothers in childbirth. In an effort to change that, village midwives are being linked to modern medicine.

headline.main: Training Midwives to Save Expectant Mothers in Chiapas

docs.abstract: Aid groups and Mexican government have begun programs to link modern medicine and traditional midwifery in effort to reduce mortality among mothers in childbirth; death rates are particularly high in poor regions like Chiapas, where researchers estimate 55 of every 100,000 women in childbirth die.
docs.snippet: The Mexican state, like many poor areas, has a high death rate among mothers in childbirth. In an effort to change that, village midwives are being linked to modern medicine.

byline.contributor: Janet Jarman contributed reporting from Mexico.

docs.lead_paragraph: The country sees success in its 15-year campaign against lockjaw, in part by providing incentives for mothers to give birth in clean conditions

headline.main: India Virtually Eliminates Tetanus as a Killer
headline.print_headline: India Eliminates Tetanus as a Deadly Threat

docs.abstract: India announces that, after 15-year effort, it has reduced cases of tetanus to less than one per 1,000 births, virtually eliminating disease that has been killer of newborn infants and mothers delivering their babies at home.
docs.snippet: The country sees success in its 15-year campaign against lockjaw, in part by providing incentives for mothers to give birth in clean conditions
